result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:43 AM Defendant Deanna Rae Coon appeared by video, in custody from Barron County Jail.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Deanna Rae Coon.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Judge Angeline Winton appears by video from Washburn County. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Court addresses parties on video appearances, all parties agrees to proceed.   Attny  Erdman acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.   Attny Erdman makes bond argument.  State opposes bond modification.  Discussion regarding bonds takes place.  Court converts bond to SIBS $1500 ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. 11:53 AM OFF THE RECORD for scheduling.

Status conference scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on January 20, 2023 at 01:15 pm.
Motion to Modify Bond

1:03 PM Defendant Deanna Rae Coon appeared by video from Koinonia Treatment Facility.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Deanna Rae Coon in Cases  21CF323, 21Cf275, 22F216,21CF225, 21CF332.  Attorney Stephen Zuber appeared by video for Deanna Rae Coon in Cases  20CF336, 21CM97. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Judge Angeline Winton appears by video from Washburn County.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Erdman indicates DEF intends to waive preliminary hearing.  Court has discussion with DEF regarding right to have hearing in person, with all parties present.  DEF understands and agrees to proceeds by video.  Atty Erdman indicates DEF waives preliminary hearing.  Court advised the DEF as to her right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived her right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.    1:13 PM  OFF THE RECORD for scheduling.  1:16 PM  BACK ON THE RECORD:  Attny Erdman makes bond request  modification. DEF indicates,  Sept 29 discharge date from Koinonia Treatment facility and outpatient treatment will be held at Bizhiiki Wellness Center.   State is opposed to DEF remaining on SIBS bond.   Court denies bond modification at this time, upon completion of treatment Cash bond will go back into effect.
Arraignment scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Arraignment on October 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Supervision Report - Justice Point

Cash Bond converts to SIBS  $1500  -  EFFECTIVE Monday 08/22/2022 - 7:00 am Bond is converted. Defendant must be transported by LCO Representative to Bizhiiki Wellness Center to complete paperwork with Counselor (Eunice) around 8:30 am Defendant will be transported to Koinonia Residential Treatment Facility in Rhinelander, WI. Defendant must remain in treatment for scheduled inpatient treatment. If defendant leaves the treatment facility or upon completion, defendant must report back to the Sawyer County Jail. SIB will be converted back to a CBS $1500.

3:00 PM Judge Angeline Winton appears by video from Washburn County. Defendant Deanna Rae Coon appeared by video from the Sawyer County Jail. Attorney Michelle M Erdman (special appearance) appeared by video for Deanna Rae Coon. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews record. Clerk scanned the counseling document on 21CF332 received by the DEF husband. Atty Erdman makes a comment on the counseling document that was handed in, she requests for the DEF to be released for treatment. Court received filed document and reviews and shows all parties via zoom. DEF husband speaks on the treatment documentation - Douglas Coon. DEF husband makes a statement. State makes statement as to confusion with bonds.  State makes comment on the arrangements made for the transportation of the DEF. State requests to look at the bond in 21CF332. State refers to the bond for possible modification during her release to the Treatment Center. Clerk goes over the bond list for each case. Court discusses with the DEF on bond modification. Court orders SIB be converted to a cash bond $1500 with same conditions. 

COURT: Will amend the bond of 22CF216 to amount of $1500 CBS. The CBS will then be amended to a $1500 SIB during her time of treatment. Once the treatment is finished and she returns to the Sawyer County Jail, the bond will be amended back to a CBS of $1500.  (Even if program is completed, she must still return to the Sawyer County Jail.)

SIBS  $1500  -  EFFECTIVE Monday 08/22/2022 - 7:00 am Bond is converted. SIB will be converted back to a CBS $1500.

2:00 PM Judge Angeline Winton appears by video from Washburn County. Defendant Deanna Rae Coon in court, from the custody of the Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Deanna Rae Coon.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl by video for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court reviews the charges and penalties. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date and has waived further reading. Atty asks for Not Guilty plea to be placed for count 2. DEF and Atty Erdman wish to waive the preliminary hearing. Court addresses DEF as to right to have preliminary hearing. Court asks Atty Erdman if she wants to waive time limits of preliminary hearing, rather than waive the preliminary hearing. The DEF and Atty Erdman have agreed to waive the time limits of the preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Erdman - No objection.  Court sets bond.   

COURT: SIB $2500
